get.description:
Get token for the currently logged-in user.
Version: 9.4.0.cl or later

user_identifier.description: GUID / name of the user to search

display_name.description: A unique display name string for the user account, usually their first and last name

name_pattern.description: A pattern to match case-insensitive name of the User object.

group_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the group to which the user belongs

account_status.description: Current status of the user account.

notify_on_share.description:
User preference for receiving email notifications when another ThoughtSpot user
shares a metadata object such as Answer, Liveboard, or Worksheet.

show_onboarding_experience.description: The user preference for revisiting the onboarding experience

onboarding_experience_completed.description: Indicates if the user has completed the onboarding walkthrough

org_identifiers.description: IDs or names of the Orgs to which the user belongs

home_liveboard_identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the user's home Liveboard.

favorite_metadata.description: Metadata objects which are assigned as favorites of the user.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records that should be included.

role_identifiers.description: Filters by the role assigned to the user.

include_favorite_metadata.description: Indicates if the user's favorite objects should be displayed.

org_identifier.description: ID or name of the Org

user_identifiers.description: GUIDs or names of the users for which you want to retrieve the Orgs data

tag_identifier.description: Name or Id of the tag.

name_pattern.description: A pattern to match case-insensitive name of the Tag object.

default_liveboard_identifiers.description: GUID of Liveboards that are assigned as default Liveboards to the users in the group.

name_pattern.description: A pattern to match case-insensitive name of the Group object.

group_identifier.description: GUID or name of the group

org_identifiers.description: ID or name of the Org to which the group belongs

sub_group_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the sub groups. A subgroup is a group assigned to a parent group.

user_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the users assigned to the group.

visibility.description:
Visibility of the group. To make a group visible to other users and groups,
set the visibility to SHAREABLE.

role_identifiers.description: Filter groups with a list of Roles assigned to a group

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records that should be included.

sort_options.description: Sort options to filter group details.

metadata.description: Metadata objects such as Liveboards, Answers, and Worksheets.

permissions.description: Object permission details to search by.

created_by_user_identifiers.description: GUID or name of user who created the metadata object.

dependent_object_version.description: Version of the dependent table of the metadata objects like Worksheets.

exclude_objects.description: List of metadata objects to exclude from search.

favorite_object_options.description:
Options to sort the API response by objects set as favorites
for the logged-in user or the users specified in the API request.

include_dependent_objects.description:
Includes dependents of the metadata object specified in the API request.
For example, a worksheet can consist of dependent objects such as Liveboards or Answers.

include_details.description: Includes complete details of the metadata objects.

include_headers.description: Includes headers of the metadata objects.

include_hidden_objects.description: Includes details of the hidden objects, such as a column in a worksheet or a table.

include_visualization_headers.description: Includes visualization headers of the specified Liveboard object.

include_worksheet_search_assist_data.description:
If search assistance lessons are configured on a worksheet,
the API returns the search assist data for Worksheet objects.

modified_by_user_identifiers.description: Includes ID or names of the users who modified the metadata object.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records that should be included.

sort_options.description: Sort options to filter metadata details.

tag_identifiers.description: Tags to filter metadata objects by

include_stats.description: Indicates whether to include stats of the metadata objects.

metadata_identifier.description: ID or name of the Liveboard.

visualization_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of visualizations.

metadata_identifier.description: ID or name of an Answer.
GUID or name of the Liveboard object.

visualization_identifiers.description:
GUID or name of visualizations on the Liveboard. If this parameter is
not defined, the API returns a report with all visualizations saved on a Liveboard.

runtime_filter.description: JSON object with representing filter condition to apply filters at runtime. For example, {"col1": "region", "op1": "EQ", "val1": "northeast" }. You can add multiple keys by incrementing the number at the end, for example, col2, op2, val2. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_filters).

runtime_sort.description: JSON string representing runtime sort. For example, {"sortCol1": "region", "asc1" : true}. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_sort).

runtime_param_override.description: JSON object for setting values of parameters at runtime. For example, {"param1": "Double List Param", "paramVal1": 0.5}. You can add multiple keys by incrementing the number at the end, for example, param2, paramVal2. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_parameters).

metadata_identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the metadata object.

runtime_filter.description:
JSON string representing runtime filter.
{ col1:region, op1: EQ, val1: northeast }

runtime_sort.description:
JSON string representing runtime sort.
{ sortCol1: region, asc1 :true, sortCol2 : date }

runtime_param_override.description: JSON object for setting values of parameters in runtime.

principals.description: GUID or name of the user or group.

metadata.description:
Metadata objects for which you want to fetch permission details.
If not specified, the API returns permission details for all
metadata objects that the specified users and groups can access.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included for each metadata type.

record_size.description: The number of records that should be included for each metadata type.

default_metadata_type.description: When no metadata objects input is passed, metadata objects of this type are fetched.

metadata.description: GUID or name of the metadata object.

principals.description:
User or group objects for which you want to fetch permissions.
If not specified, the API returns all users and groups that
can access the specified metadata objects.

include_dependent_objects.description: Indicates whether to fetch permissions of dependent metadata objects.

query_string.description: Query string with search tokens. For example, [Sales][Region]. See [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_search_data_api)

logical_table_identifier.description: GUID of the data source object, such as a Worksheet, View, or Table. You can find the GUID of a data object from the UI or via API. See [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_search_query) for more details.

data_format.description: JSON output format. By default, the API returns full data in the JSON.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records to include in a batch.

runtime_filter.description: JSON object with representing filter condition to apply filters at runtime. For example, {"col1": "item type", "op1": "EQ", "val1": "Bags"} . You can add multiple keys by incrementing the number at the end, for example, col2, op2, val2, and col3, op3, val3. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_filters).

runtime_sort.description: JSON object representing columns to sort data at runtime. For example, {"sortCol1": "sales", "asc1": true} . You can add multiple keys by incrementing the number at the end, for example, sortCol1, asc2. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_sort).

runtime_param_override.description: JSON object for setting values of parameters at runtime. For example, {"param1": "Double List Param", "paramVal1": 0.5}. You can add multiple keys by incrementing the number at the end, for example, param2, paramVal2. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_parameters).

metadata_identifier.description: GUID or name of the Liveboard.

visualization_identifiers.description: GUIDs or names of the visualizations on the Liveboard.

data_format.description: JSON output format. By default, the API returns full data in the JSON.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records to include in a batch.

runtime_filter.description: JSON object with representing filter condition to apply filters at runtime. For example, {"col1": "item type", "op1": "EQ", "val1": "Bags"} . You can add multiple keys by incrementing the number at the end, for example, col2, op2, val2, and col3, op3, val3. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_filters).

runtime_sort.description: JSON object representing columns to sort data at runtime. For example, {"sortCol1": "sales", "asc1": true} . You can add multiple keys by incrementing the number at the end, for example, sortCol1, asc2. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_sort).

runtime_param_override.description: JSON object for setting values of parameters at runtime. For example, {"param1": "Double List Param", "paramVal1": 0.5}. You can add multiple keys by incrementing the number at the end, for example, param2, paramVal2. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_parameters).

metadata_identifier.description: GUID or name of the Answer.

data_format.description: JSON output format. By default, the API returns full data in the JSON.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records to include in a batch.

runtime_filter.description: JSON object with representing filter condition to apply filters at runtime. For example, {"col1": "item type", "op1": "EQ", "val1": "Bags"} . You can add multiple keys by incrementing the number at the end, for example, col2, op2, val2, and col3, op3, val3. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_filters).

runtime_sort.description: JSON object representing columns to sort data at runtime. For example, {"sortCol1": "sales", "asc1": true} . You can add multiple keys by incrementing the number at the end, for example, sortCol1, asc2. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_sort).

runtime_param_override.description: JSON object for setting values of parameters at runtime. For example, {"param1": "Double List Param", "paramVal1": 0.5}. You can add multiple keys by incrementing the number at the end, for example, param2, paramVal2. For more information, see [API Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/fetch-data-and-report-apis#_runtime_parameters).

get_all_logs.description: Fetch all the logs. This is available from 9.11.0.cl

org_identifiers.description:
Applicable when Orgs is enabled in the cluster List of Org ids or name. Provide value -1 for cluster level. Example : ["OrgID1-or-Name1", "OrgID2-or-Name2"] Note: If no value is specified, then the configurations will be returned for all orgs the user has access to
Version: 9.5.0.cl or later

metadata_identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the metadata.

branch_name.description:
Name of the branch from which commit history needs to be displayed.
   

Note: If no branch_name is specified, then commits will be returned for the default branch for this configuration.

record_offset.description:
Record offset point in the commit history to display the response.
    

Note: If no record offset is specified, the beginning of the record will be considered.

record_size.description:
Number of history records from record offset point to be displayed in the response.
    

Note: If no record size is specified, then all the records will be considered.

connections.description: List of connections and name pattern

data_warehouse_types.description: Array of types of data warehouse defined for the connection.

record_offset.description: The starting record number from where the records should be included.

record_size.description: The number of records that should be included.

tag_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of tags.

include_details.description: Indicates whether to include complete details of the connection objects.

configuration.description: Configuration values. If empty we are fetching configuration from datasource based on given connection id. If required you can provide config details to fetch specific details. Example input: {}, {"warehouse":"SMALL_WH","database":"DEVELOPMENT"}. This is only applicable when data_warehouse_object_type is selected.

authentication_type.description: List of authentication types to fetch data_ware_house_objects from external Data warehouse. This is only applicable when data_warehouse_object_type is selected.

post.description:
Gets Roles configured on a ThoughtSpot instance. Requires cluster Administration, Role Administration or Group Administration privileges.
Version: 9.5.0.cl or later

role_identifiers.description: unique ID or name of the Roles

org_identifiers.description: Unique Id or name of the Organisation

group_identifiers.description: Unique Id or name of the User Group

privileges.description: Privileges assigned to the Role. See [Documentation](https://developers.thoughtspot.com/docs/rbac#_role_categories_and_privileges)for supported roles privileges.

deprecated.description: Indicates whether the Role is deprecated.

external.description: Indicates whether the Role is external

shared_via_connection.description: Indicates whether the Role is shared via connection

custom_action_identifier.description: Name or ID of the custom action.

name_pattern.description: A pattern to match case-insensitive name of the custom-action object.

default_action_config.description: Default Custom action configuration. This includes if the custom action is available on all visualizations. By default, a custom action is added to all visualizations and Answers.

include_group_associations.description: When set to true, returns the associated groups for a custom action.

include_metadata_associations.description: When set to true, returns the associated metadata for a custom action.

metadata.description: Search with a given metadata identifier.

type.description: Filter the action objects based on type

org_identifier.description: ID of the Org context to log in to. If Org ID is not specified, the user will be logged in to the Org context of their previous login session.

remember_me.description: A flag to remember the user session. When set to true, a session cookie is created and used in subsequent API requests.

object_id.description: GUID of the ThoughtSpot metadata object that the user can access. The bearer will only have access to the object specified in the API request.

secret_key.description: The secret key string provided by the ThoughtSpot application server. ThoughtSpot generates a secret key when Trusted authentication is enabled.

org_id.description: ID of the Org context to log in to. If Org ID is not specified, the user will be logged in to the Org context of their previous login session.

email.description: Email address of the user. Specify this attribute when creating a new user (just-in-time (JIT) provisioning).

display_name.description: Display name of the user. Specify this attribute when creating a new user (just-in-time (JIT) provisioning).

auto_create.description:
Creates a new user if the specified username does not exist in ThoughtSpot. To provision a user just-in-time (JIT), set this attribute to true.
   

Note: For JIT provisioning of a user, the secret_key is required.

group_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of the groups to which you want to assign the new user. You can specify this attribute to dynamically assign privileges during just-in-time (JIT) provisioning.

jwt_user_options.description:
JWT user options to create a JWT token given the payload.
   

*Deprecated from 9.11.0.cl : Replaced by user_parameters*

user_parameters.description:
User Parameters to be set via JWT Token.
Version: 9.11.0.cl or later

secret_key.description: The secret key string provided by the ThoughtSpot application server. ThoughtSpot generates a secret key when Trusted authentication is enabled.

org_id.description: ID of the Org context to log in to. If the Org ID is not specified, the user will be logged in to the Org context of their previous login session.

email.description: Email address of the user. Specify this attribute when creating a new user (just-in-time (JIT) provisioning).

display_name.description: Indicates display name of the user. Use this parameter to provision a user just-in-time (JIT).

auto_create.description:
Creates a new user if the specified username does not already exist in ThoughtSpot. To provision a user just-in-time (JIT), set this attribute to true.
   

Note: For JIT provisioning of a user, the secret_key is required.

group_identifiers.description: ID or name of the groups to which the newly created user belongs. Use this parameter to provision a user just-in-time (JIT).

jwt_user_options.description:
JWT user options to create a JWT token given the payload.
   

*Deprecated from 9.11.0.cl : Replaced by user_parameters*

user_parameters.description:
User Parameters to be set via JWT Token.
Version: 9.11.0.cl or later

name.description: Name of the user. The username string must be unique.

display_name.description: A unique display name string for the user account, usually their first and last name

account_status.description: Current status of the user account.

org_identifiers.description: List of Org IDs to which the user belongs.

group_identifiers.description: GUIDs or names of the groups to which the newly created user belongs.

visibility.description: Visibility of the users. When set to SHARABLE, the user is visible to other users and groups when they try to share an object.

notify_on_share.description:
User preference for receiving email notifications when another ThoughtSpot
user shares a metadata object such as Answer, Liveboard, or Worksheet.

show_onboarding_experience.description: The user preference for revisiting the onboarding experience.

onboarding_experience_completed.description: flag to get the on-boarding experience is completed or not.

home_liveboard_identifier.description:
GUID of the Liveboard to set a default Liveboard for the user.
ThoughtSpot displays this Liveboard on the Home page when the user logs in.

favorite_metadata.description: Metadata objects to add to the user's favorites list.

trigger_welcome_email.description: Flag to indicate whether welcome email should be sent to user

trigger_activation_email.description: Flag to indicate whether activation email should be sent to user

name.description: Name of the user. The username string must be unique.

display_name.description: A unique display name string for the user account, usually their first and last name

visibility.description: Visibility of the users. When set to SHARABLE, the user is visible to other users and groups when they try to share an object.

account_status.description: Current status of the user account.

notify_on_share.description:
User preference for receiving email notifications when another ThoughtSpot user
shares a metadata object such as Answer, Liveboard, or Worksheet.

show_onboarding_experience.description: The user preference for revisiting the onboarding experience.

onboarding_experience_completed.description: Indicates if the user has completed the onboarding and allows turning off the onboarding walkthrough.

group_identifiers.description: GUIDs or names of the groups.

home_liveboard_identifier.description:
GUID of the Liveboard to set a default Liveboard for the user. ThoughtSpot displays
this Liveboard on the Home page when the user logs in.

favorite_metadata.description: Metadata objects to add to the user's favorites list.

operation.description: Type of update operation. Default operation type is REPLACE

parameters.description: GUID / name of the user

parameters.description: GUID / name of the user

users.description: List of users needs to be imported.

default_password.description: The default password to assign to users if they do not have a password assigned in ThoughtSpot.

dry_run.description: If true, the API performs a test operation and returns user IDs whose data will be edited after the import.

delete_unspecified_users.description: If set to true, removes the users that are not specified in the API request.

user_identifier.description: GUID or name of the user.
GUID or name of the user.

user_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the users for force logging out their sessions.

user_identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the user.

password.description: New password for the user to access the account.

user_identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the user.

configuration.description: Configuration JSON with the key-value pair of configuration attributes to be updated.

group_identifiers.description: Add Default Groups to an Org

operation.description: Type of update operation. Default operation type is ADD

parameters.name: org_identifier
parameters.description: ID or name of the Org

parameters.name: org_identifier
parameters.description: ID or name of the Org

color.description: Hex color code to be assigned to the tag. For example, #ff78a9.
Hex color code to be assigned to the tag. For example, #ff78a9.

parameters.description: Name or Id of the tag.

parameters.description: Tag identifier Tag name or Tag id.

tag_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the tag.
GUID or name of the tag.

name.description: Name of the group. The group name must be unique.

default_liveboard_identifiers.description: GUID of the Liveboards to assign as default Liveboards to the users in the group.

privileges.description: Privileges to assign to the group

sub_group_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the sub groups. A subgroup is a group assigned to a parent group.

user_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the users to assign to the group.

visibility.description:
Visibility of the group. To make a group visible to other users and groups,
set the visibility to SHAREABLE.

role_identifiers.description: Role identifiers of the roles that should be assigned to the group.

name.description: Name of the group to modify.

default_liveboard_identifiers.description: ID of the Liveboards to be assigned as default Liveboards to the users in the group.

privileges.description: Privileges to assign to the group.

sub_group_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the sub groups. A subgroup is a group assigned to a parent group.

user_identifiers.description: GUID or name of the users to assign to the group.

visibility.description:
Visibility of the group. To make a group visible to other users and
groups, set the visibility to SHAREABLE.

role_identifiers.description: Role identifiers of the Roles that should be assigned to the group.

operation.description: Type of update operation. Default operation type is REPLACE

parameters.name: group_identifier
parameters.description: GUID or name of the group.

parameters.name: group_identifier
parameters.description: GUID or name of the group.

groups.description: Details of groups which are to be imported

delete_unspecified_groups.description: If set to true, removes groups that are not specified in the API request.

dry_run.description:
If true, the API performs a test operation and returns user IDs whose
data will be edited after the import.

import_policy.description: Specifies the import policy for the TML import.

create_new.description: If selected, creates TML objects with new GUIDs.

all_orgs_context.description: If import is happening from all orgs context.

export_associated.description: Indicates whether to export associated metadata objects of specified metadata objects.

export_fqn.description:
Adds FQNs of the referenced objects. For example, if you are exporting a Liveboard and its associated objects,
the API returns the Liveboard TML data with the FQNs of the referenced worksheet.
If the exported TML data includes FQNs, you don't need to manually add FQNs of the referenced objects during TML import.

export_schema_version.description: Indicates whether to export worksheet TML in V1 or V2 version.

export_dependent.description: Indicates whether to export table while exporting connection.

export_connection_as_dependent.description:
Indicates whether to export connection as dependent while exporting table/worksheet/answer/liveboard.
This will only be active when export_associated is true.

all_orgs_override.description: Indicates whether to export is happening from all orgs context.

delete_disabled_objects.description: Indicates whether to delete disabled metadata objects.

metadata.description: GUID or name of the metadata object.

user_identifier.description: GUID or name of the user who you want to assign as the author.

current_owner_identifier.description:
GUID or name of the current author.  When defined, the metadata objects
authored by the specified owner are filtered for the API operation.

metadata_type.description:
Type of metadata.
1. Liveboard
2. Answers
3. LOGICAL_TABLE for any data object such as table, worksheet or view.

metadata_identifiers.description: Unique ID or name of metadata objects. Note: All the identifiers should belong to same metadata_type

permissions.description: Permission details for sharing the objects.

visualization_identifiers.description: Options to specify details of Liveboard.

emails.description: Email IDs to which notifications will be sent.

message.description: Message to be included in notification.

enable_custom_url.description: Sends object URLs in the customized format in email notifications.

notify_on_share.description: Flag to notify user when any object is shared.

has_lenient_discoverability.description: Flag to make the object discoverable.

repository_url.description: URL for connecting to remote repository

username.description: Username to authenticate connection to remote repository

access_token.description: Access token corresponding to the user to authenticate connection to remote repository

org_identifier.description:
Applicable when Orgs is enabled in the cluster List of Org ids or name. Provide value -1 for cluster level. Example : ["OrgID1-or-Name1", "OrgID2-or-Name2"] Note: If no value is specified, then the configurations will be returned for all orgs the user has access to
Version: 9.5.0.cl or later

branch_names.description: List the remote branches to configure. Example:[development, production]

commit_branch_name.description:
Name of the remote branch where objects from this Thoughtspot instance will be versioned.
Version: 9.7.0.cl or later

enable_guid_mapping.description:
Maintain mapping of guid for the deployment to an instance
Version: 9.4.0.cl or later

configuration_branch_name.description:
Name of the branch where the configuration files related to operations between Thoughtspot and version control repo should be maintained. Note: If no branch name is specified, then by default, ts_config_files branch is considered. Ensure this branch exists before configuration.
Version: 9.7.0.cl or later

username.description: Username to authenticate connection to version control system

access_token.description: Access token corresponding to the user to authenticate connection to version control system

org_identifier.description:
Applicable when Orgs is enabled in the cluster List of Org ids or name. Provide value -1 for cluster level. Example : ["OrgID1-or-Name1", "OrgID2-or-Name2"] Note: If no value is specified, then the configurations will be returned for all orgs the user has access to
Version: 9.5.0.cl or later

branch_names.description: List the remote branches to configure. Example:[development, production]

commit_branch_name.description:
Name of the remote branch where objects from this Thoughtspot instance will be versioned.
Version: 9.7.0.cl or later

enable_guid_mapping.description:
Maintain mapping of guid for the deployment to an instance
Version: 9.4.0.cl or later

configuration_branch_name.description:
Name of the branch where the configuration files related to operations between Thoughtspot and version control repo should be maintained.
Version: 9.7.0.cl or later

cluster_level.description:
Applicable when Orgs is enabled in the cluster Indicator to consider cluster level or org level config. Set it to false to delete configuration from current org. If set to true, then the configuration at cluster level and orgs that inherited the configuration from cluster level will be deleted.
Version: 9.5.0.cl or later

delete_aware.description: Delete the tml files from version control repo if it does not exist in the ThoughSpot instance

branch_name.description:
Name of the remote branch where object should be pushed
   

Note: If no branch_name is specified, then the commit_branch_name will be considered.

comment.description: Comment to be added to the commit

branch_name.description:
Name of the branch where the reverted version should be committed
   

Note: If no branch_name is specified, then the commit_branch_name will be considered.

revert_policy.description: Policy to apply when reverting a commit. Valid values: [ALL_OR_NONE, PARTIAL]

parameters.name: commit_id
parameters.description: Commit id to which the object should be reverted

source_branch_name.description: Name of the branch from which changes need to be picked for validation

target_branch_name.description: Name of the branch where files will be merged

commit_id.description:
Commit_id against which the files should be picked to deploy.
   

Note: If no commit_id is specified, then the head of the branch is considered.

branch_name.description: Name of the remote branch where changes should be picked

deploy_type.description: Indicates if all files or only modified file at specified commit point should be considered

deploy_policy.description: Define the policy to follow while importing TML in the ThoughtSpot environment. Use ALL_OR_NONE to cancel the deployment of all ThoughtSpot objects if at least one of them fails to import. Use Partial to import ThoughtSpot objects that validate successfully even if other objects in the same deploy operations fail to import.

data_warehouse_config.description: Connection configuration attributes in JSON format. To create a connection with tables, include table attributes. See the documentation above for sample JSON.

validate.description: Validates the connection metadata if tables are included. If you are creating a connection without tables, specify `false`.

name_pattern.description: A pattern to match the case-insensitive name of the metadata object. User % for a wildcard match.

type.description:
Type of metadata. Required if the name of the object is set as identifier. This attribute is optional when the object GUID is specified as identifier.
1. Liveboard
2. Answers
3. LOGICAL_TABLE for any data object such as table, worksheet or view.
4. LOGICAL_COLUMN for a column of any data object such as table, worksheet or view.
5. CONNECTION for creating or modify data connections.
6. TAG for tag objects.
7. USER for user objects.
8. USER_GROUP for group objects.
9. LOGICAL_RELATIONSHIP for table or worksheet joins. A join combines from one or several data object by using matching values

identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the metadata.

type.description:
Type of metadata. Required if the name of the object is set as identifier. This attribute is optional when the object GUID is specified as identifier.
1. Liveboard
2. Answers
3. LOGICAL_TABLE for any data object such as table, worksheet or view
4. LOGICAL_COLUMN for a column of any data object such as table, worksheet or view
5. CONNECTION for connection objects
6. TAG for tag objects
7. USER for user objects
8. USER_GROUP for group objects
9. LOGICAL_RELATIONSHIP for table or worksheet joins. A join combines from one or several data object by using matching values.

Basic_AuthInput.description: Basic Auth: Basic authentication involves sending a verified username and password with your request.

key.description: Key for the url query parameter

value.description: Value for the url query parameter

action_config.description: Specify that the association is enabled for the metadata object

identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the metadata.

position.description: Position of the Custom action on the Metadata object. Earlier naming convention: context.

visibility.description: Visibility of the metadata association with custom action. Earlier naming convention: enabled

ActionConfigInputCreate.description: Specify that the association is enabled for the metadata object Default

visibility.description:
Custom action is available on all visualizations. Earlier naming convention: LOCAL/GLOBAL. TRUE signifies GLOBAL for backward compatibility.
Default: true

Default_Action_Config_Input_Create.description: Default Custom action configuration. This includes the custom action's visibility across all visualizations and Answers. By default, a custom action is added to all visualizations and Answers.

Action_Details_Input.description: Action details includes `Type` and configuration details of Custom Actions. Either Callback or URL is required.

reference.description: Reference name. By default, the value will be set to action name.

authentication.description: Authorization type for the custom action.

parameters.description: Query parameters for url.

url.description: Request Url for the Custom action.

reference.description: Reference name. By default the value will be set to action name

action_config.description: Specify that the association is enabled for the metadata object

identifier.description: Unique ID or name of the metadata.

position.description: Position of the Custom action on the Metadata object. Earlier naming convention: context.

visibility.description: Visibility of the metadata association with custom action. Earlier naming convention: enabled

ActionConfigInput.description: Specify that the association is enabled for the metadata object Default

visibility.description: Custom action is available on all visualizations. Earlier naming convention: LOCAL/GLOBAL. TRUE signifies GLOBAL for backward compatibility.

Default_Action_Config_Input.description: Default Custom action configuration. This includes the custom action's visibility across all visualizations and Answers. By default, a custom action is added to all visualizations and Answers.

model_path.description: Model directory path, this is optional param and required if there are duplicate models with the same name.

runtime_filter.description: Runtime filter parameter type in JWT.

Runtime_Filter.description: List of runtime parameters need to set during the session.

runtime_sort.description: Runtime sort parameter type in JWT.

Runtime_Sort.description: List of runtime parameters need to set during the session.

runtime_param_override.description: Runtime param override type in JWT.

Runtime_Param_Override.description: List of runtime parameters need to set during the session.
